line.text: Who will believe my verse in time to come
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If it were filled with your most high deserts
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Though yet heaven knows it is but as a tomb
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Which hides your life and shows not half your parts
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If I could write the beauty of your eyes
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And in fresh numbers number all your graces
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The age to come would say this poet lies
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Such heavenly touches neer touched earthly faces
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So should my papers (yellowed with their age)
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Be scorned like old men of less truth than tongue
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And your true rights be termed a poet rage
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And stretched metre of an antique song
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But were some child of yours alive that time
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: You should live twice in it and in my rhyme
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
